Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox

Interface MessageContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IndexedMessageContext, ParsedMessageContext
    public interface MessageContext
    Context providing access to message data during search evaluation.

    This interface allows SearchCriteria implementations to access message attributes, headers, and content without requiring the full message to be loaded into memory.

    Implementations should load data lazily where possible to optimize search performance for large mailboxes.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    SearchCriteria

      • getMessageNumber

        int getMessageNumber()
        Returns the message sequence number (1-based).
        Returns:
        the message sequence number

        Returns the message UID.
        Returns:

      • getSize

        long getSize()
        Returns the message size in octets.

      • getFlags

        Returns the message system flags.
        Returns:

      • getKeywords

        default java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeywords()
        Returns the message keyword flags. Keywords are user-defined flags (non-system flags).
        Returns:
        set of keyword strings, empty if none

      • getInternalDate

        java.time.OffsetDateTime getInternalDate()
        Returns the internal date of the message. This is the date the message was received by the server.
        Returns:
        the internal date, or null if not available

      • getHeader

        java.lang.String getHeader​(java.lang.String name)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the value of the first header with the given name. Header names are case-insensitive.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name (e.g., "Subject", "From")
        Returns:
        the header value, or null if not present
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if headers cannot be read

      • getHeaders

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getHeaders​(java.lang.String name)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Returns all values for headers with the given name. Header names are case-insensitive.
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        Returns:
        list of header values, empty if none present
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if headers cannot be read

      • getSentDate

        java.time.OffsetDateTime getSentDate()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the sent date from the Date header.
        Returns:
        the sent date, or null if not available or unparseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if headers cannot be read

      • getInternalLocalDate

        default java.time.LocalDate getInternalLocalDate()
        Returns the internal date as a LocalDate for date comparisons. The date is extracted in the original timezone.
        Returns:
        the internal date as LocalDate, or null if not available

      • getSentLocalDate

        default java.time.LocalDate getSentLocalDate()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the sent date as a LocalDate for date comparisons. The date is extracted in the original timezone.
        Returns:
        the sent date as LocalDate, or null if not available
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if headers cannot be read

      • getHeadersText

        java.lang.CharSequence getHeadersText()
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the message headers as text for TEXT search.
        Returns:
        the headers as a character sequence
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if headers cannot be read

      • getBodyText

        java.lang.CharSequence getBodyText()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the message body as text for BODY/TEXT search.

        For MIME messages, this should return the decoded text content of all text parts concatenated.

        Returns:
        the body text as a character sequence
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if body cannot be read
